intro: Didissandra aspera, commonly known as the rough didissandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
